get.summary: Retrieve a configuration for Iot Hub devices and modules by it identifier.
get.description: For IoT Hub VNET related features(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support) please use API version '2020-03-13'.These features are currently in general availability in the East US, West US 2, and Southcentral US regions only. We are actively working to expand the availability of these features to all regions by end of month May. For rest of the APIs please continue using API version '2019-10-01'

put.summary: Create or update the configuration for devices or modules of an IoT hub. An ETag must not be specified for the create operation. An ETag must be specified for the update operation. Note that configuration Id and Content cannot be updated by the user.
put.description: For IoT Hub VNET related features(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support) please use API version '2020-03-13'.These features are currently in general availability in the East US, West US 2, and Southcentral US regions only. We are actively working to expand the availability of these features to all regions by end of month May. For rest of the APIs please continue using API version '2019-10-01'

delete.summary: Delete the configuration for devices or modules of an IoT hub. This request requires the If-Match header. The client may specify the ETag for the device identity on the request in order to compare to the ETag maintained by the service for the purpose of optimistic concurrency. The delete operation is performed only if the ETag sent by the client matches the value maintained by the server, indicating that the device identity has not been modified since it was retrieved by the client. To force an unconditional delete, set If-Match to the wildcard character (*).
delete.description: For IoT Hub VNET related features(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support) please use API version '2020-03-13'.These features are currently in general availability in the East US, West US 2, and Southcentral US regions only. We are actively working to expand the availability of these features to all regions by end of month May. For rest of the APIs please continue using API version '2019-10-01'

get.summary: Get multiple configurations for devices or modules of an IoT Hub. Returns the specified number of configurations for Iot Hub. Pagination is not supported.
get.description: For IoT Hub VNET related features(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support) please use API version '2020-03-13'.These features are currently in general availability in the East US, West US 2, and Southcentral US regions only. We are actively working to expand the availability of these features to all regions by end of month May. For rest of the APIs please continue using API version '2019-10-01'

200.description: Returns the list of Configuration objects

get.summary: Get the identities of multiple devices from the IoT hub identity registry. Not recommended. Use the IoT Hub query language to retrieve device twin and device identity information. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/iothub/service/queryiothub and https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-devguide-query-language for more information.
get.description: For IoT Hub VNET related features(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support) please use API version '2020-03-13'.These features are currently in general availability in the East US, West US 2, and Southcentral US regions only. We are actively working to expand the availability of these features to all regions by end of month May. For rest of the APIs please continue using API version '2019-10-01'

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: This parameter when specified, defines the maximum number of device identities that are returned. Any value outside the range of 1-1000 is considered to be 1000.

post.summary: Create, update, or delete the identities of multiple devices from the IoT hub identity registry.
post.description: Create, update, or delete the identiies of multiple devices from the IoT hub identity registry. A device identity can be specified only once in the list. Different operations (create, update, delete) on different devices are allowed. A maximum of 100 devices can be specified per invocation. For large scale operations, consider using the import feature using blob storage(https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-devguide-identity-registry#import-and-export-device-identities). For IoT Hub VNET related features(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support) please use API version '2020-03-13'.These features are currently in general availability in the East US, West US 2, and Southcentral US regions only. We are actively working to expand the availability of these features to all regions by end of month May. For rest of the APIs please continue using API version '2019-10-01'

post.summary: Query an IoT hub to retrieve information regarding device twins using a SQL-like language.
post.description: Query an IoT hub to retrieve information regarding device twins using a SQL-like language. See https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-devguide-query-language for more information. Pagination of results is supported. This returns information about device twins only. For IoT Hub VNET related features(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support) please use API version '2020-03-13'.These features are currently in general availability in the East US, West US 2, and Southcentral US regions only. We are actively working to expand the availability of these features to all regions by end of month May. For rest of the APIs please continue using API version '2019-10-01'

200.description: Query result with continuation token if appropriate.

An ETag must be specified for the update operation. Note that generationId and deviceId cannot be updated by the user. delete.summary: Delete the identity of a device from the identity registry of an IoT hub.
delete.description: Delete the identity of a device from the identity registry of an IoT hub. This request requires the If-Match header. The client may specify the ETag for the device identity on the request in order to compare to the ETag maintained by the service for the purpose of optimistic concurrency. The delete operation is performed only if the ETag sent by the client matches the value maintained by the server, indicating that the device identity has not been modified since it was retrieved by the client. To force an unconditional delete, set If-Match to the wildcard character (*). For IoT Hub VNET related features(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support) please use API version '2020-03-13'.These features are currently in general availability in the East US, West US 2, and Southcentral US regions only. get.summary: This method is used to retrieve feedback of a cloud-to-device message.
get.description: This method is used to retrieve feedback of a cloud-to-device message See https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-devguide-messaging for more information. This capability is only available in the standard tier IoT Hub. For more information, see [Choose the right IoT Hub tier](https://aka.ms/scaleyouriotsolution). For IoT Hub VNET related features(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support) please use API version '2020-03-13'.These features are currently in general availability in the East US, West US 2, and Southcentral US regions only. We are actively working to expand the availability of these features to all regions by end of month May. For rest of the APIs please continue using API version '2019-10-01'

204.description: No Content Sent if feedback queue is empty

delete.summary: This method completes a feedback message.
delete.description: This method completes a feedback message. The lockToken obtained when the message was received must be provided to resolve race conditions when completing, a feedback message. A completed message is deleted from the feedback queue. See https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-devguide-messaging for more information. For IoT Hub VNET related features(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support) please use API version '2020-03-13'.These features are currently in general availability in the East US, West US 2, and Southcentral US regions only. We are actively working to expand the availability of these features to all regions by end of month May. For rest of the APIs please continue using API version '2019-10-01'

post.summary: This method abandons a feedback message.
post.description: This method abandons a feedback message. The lockToken obtained when the message was received must be provided to resolve race conditions when abandoning, a feedback message. A abandoned message is deleted from the feedback queue. See https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-hub/iot-hub-devguide-messaging for more information. For IoT Hub VNET related features(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support) please use API version '2020-03-13'.These features are currently in general availability in the East US, West US 2, and Southcentral US regions only. We are actively working to expand the availability of these features to all regions by end of month May. For rest of the APIs please continue using API version '2019-10-01'

The client may specify the ETag for the device identity on the request in order to compare to the ETag maintained by the service for the purpose of optimistic concurrency. The delete operation is performed only if the ETag sent by the client matches the value maintained by the server, indicating that the device identity has not been modified since it was retrieved by the client. get.summary:
Returns a DigitalTwin model definition for the given id.
If "expand" is present in the query parameters and id is for a device capability model then it returns
the capability metamodel with expanded interface definitions.
get.description: For IoT Hub VNET related features(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/iot-hub/virtual-network-support) please use API version '2020-03-13'.These features are currently in general availability in the East US, West US 2, and Southcentral US regions only. We are actively working to expand the availability of these features to all regions by end of month May. For rest of the APIs please continue using API version '2019-10-01'

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to expand the device capability model's interface definitions inline or not.
This query parameter ONLY applies to Capability model.

x-ms-model-resolution-status.description: Digital twin model resolution status: enum [Pending, Success, NotFound, Failed, Resolved, Deleted]

x-ms-model-resolution-description.description: Digital twin model resolution status description.

204.description: Model is not resolved, See the 'x-ms-model-resolution-description' and 'x-ms-model-resolution-status' for the resolution status code and description.

x-ms-model-resolution-status.description: Digital twin model resolution status: enum [Pending, Success, NotFound, Failed, Resolved, Deleted]

x-ms-model-resolution-description.description: Digital twin model resolution status description.

post.description: Invoke a digital twin interface command.

200.description: Returns the digital twin command response payload

x-ms-command-statuscode.description: Device Generated Status Code for this Operation

x-ms-request-id.description: Server Generated Request Id (GUID), to uniquely identify this request in the service

Configuration.description: Configuration for IotHub devices and modules.

schemaVersion.description: Gets Schema version for the configuration

labels.description: Gets or sets labels for the configuration

content.description: Gets or sets Content for the configuration

targetCondition.description: Gets or sets Target Condition for the configuration

createdTimeUtc.description: Gets creation time for the configuration

lastUpdatedTimeUtc.description: Gets last update time for the configuration

priority.description: Gets or sets Priority for the configuration

ConfigurationContent.description: Configuration Content for Devices or Modules on Edge Devices.

DeviceCapabilities.description: Status of Capabilities enabled on the device

moduleId.description: ModuleId is applicable to modules only

eTag.description: ETag parameter is only used for pre-conditioning the update when importMode is updateIfMatchETag

status.description: Status is optional and defaults to enabled

authentication.description: Authentication parameter is optional and defaults to SAS if not provided. In that case, we auto-generate primary/secondary access keys

twinETag.description: twinETag parameter is only used for pre-conditioning the update when importMode is updateTwinIfMatchETag

properties.description: Properties are optional and defaults to empty object

capabilities.description: Capabilities param is optional and defaults to no capability

desired.description: Used in conjunction with reported properties to synchronize device configuration or condition. Desired properties can only be set by the solution back end and can be read by the device app. The device app can also be notified in real time of changes on the desired properties.

reported.description: Used in conjunction with desired properties to synchronize device configuration or condition. Reported properties can only be set by the device app and can be read and queried by the solution back end.

BulkRegistryOperationResult.description: Encapsulates the result of a bulk registry operation.

isSuccessful.description: Whether or not the operation was successful.

errors.description: If the operation was not successful, this contains an array of DeviceRegistryOperationError objects.

warnings.description: If the operation was partially successful, this contains an array of DeviceRegistryOperationWarning objects.

DeviceRegistryOperationError.description: Encapsulates device registry operation error details.

deviceId.description: The ID of the device that indicated the error.

errorStatus.description: Additional details associated with the error.

DeviceRegistryOperationWarning.description: Encapsulates device registry operation error details.

deviceId.description: The ID of the device that indicated the warning.

warningStatus.description: Additional details associated with the warning.

deviceId.description: The deviceId uniquely identifies the device in the IoT hub's identity registry. A case-sensitive string (up to 128 char long) of ASCII 7-bit alphanumeric chars + {'-', ':', '.', '+', '%', '_', '#', '*', '?', '!', '(', ')', ',', '=', '@', ';', '$', '''}.

moduleId.description: Gets and sets the Module Id.

tags.description: A JSON document read and written by the solution back end. Tags are not visible to device apps.

properties.description: Gets and sets the Twin properties.

version.description: Version for device twin, including tags and desired properties

statusReason.description: Reason, if any, for the corresponding Device to be in specified Status

statusUpdateTime.description: Time when the corresponding Device's Status was last updated

lastActivityTime.description: The last time the device connected, received or sent a message. In ISO8601 datetime format in UTC, for example, 2015-01-28T16:24:48.789Z. This does not update if the device uses the HTTP/1 protocol to perform messaging operations.

cloudToDeviceMessageCount.description: Number of messages sent to the corresponding Device from the Cloud

desired.description: Used in conjunction with reported properties to synchronize device configuration or condition. Desired properties can only be set by the solution back end and can be read by the device app. The device app can also be notified in real time of changes on the desired properties.

reported.description: Used in conjunction with desired properties to synchronize device configuration or condition. Reported properties can only be set by the device app and can be read and queried by the solution back end.

endTimeUtc.description:
System generated.  Ignored at creation.
Represents the time the job stopped processing.

type.description:
Required.
The type of job to execute.

progress.description:
System generated.  Ignored at creation.
Represents the percentage of completion.

inputBlobContainerUri.description: URI containing SAS token to a blob container that contains registry data to sync.

inputBlobName.description: The blob name to be used when importing from the provided input blob container.

outputBlobContainerUri.description: URI containing SAS token to a blob container.  This is used to output the status of the job and the results.

outputBlobName.description:
The name of the blob that will be created in the provided output blob container.  This blob will contain
the exported device registry information for the IoT Hub.

excludeKeysInExport.description:
Optional for export jobs; ignored for other jobs.  Default: false.  If false, authorization keys are included
in export output.  Keys are exported as null otherwise.

storageAuthenticationType.description: Specifies authentication type being used for connecting to storage account.

failureReason.description:
System genereated.  Ignored at creation.
If status == failure, this represents a string containing the reason.

PurgeMessageQueueResult.description: Result of a device message queue purge operation.

deviceId.description: The ID of the device whose messages are being purged.

moduleId.description: The ID of the device whose messages are being purged.

interfaces.description: Interface(s) data on the digital twin.

name.description: Full name of digital twin interface.

properties.description: List of all properties in an interface.

value.description: The current interface property value in a digitalTwin.
The desired value of the interface property to set in a digitalTwin.

version.description: Version of the desired value received.

type.description:
Required.
The type of job to execute.

cloudToDeviceMethod.description:
Required if jobType is cloudToDeviceMethod.
The method type and parameters.

queryCondition.description:
Required if jobType is updateTwin or cloudToDeviceMethod.
Condition for device query to get devices to execute the job on

startTime.description: ISO 8601 date time to start the job

maxExecutionTimeInSeconds.description: Max execution time in secounds (ttl duration)

CloudToDeviceMethod.description: Parameters to execute a direct method on the device

startTime.description: Scheduled job start time in UTC.

endTime.description:
System generated.  Ignored at creation.
Represents the time the job stopped processing.

maxExecutionTimeInSeconds.description: Max execution time in secounds (ttl duration)

type.description:
Required.
The type of job to execute.

cloudToDeviceMethod.description:
Required if jobType is cloudToDeviceMethod.
The method type and parameters.

failureReason.description:
System generated.  Ignored at creation.
If status == failure, this represents a string containing the reason.

DeviceJobStatistics.description: The job counts, e.g., number of failed/succeeded devices

deviceCount.description: Number of devices in the job

items.description: The query result items, as a collection.

CloudToDeviceMethodResult.description: Represents the Device Method Invocation Results.

interfaces.description: Interface(s) data to patch in the digital twin.

properties.description: List of properties to update in an interface.

value.description: The desired value of the interface property to set in a digitalTwin.
